The best game i have played ever in my entire life. Thanks Valve for creating this game.

I remember first playing this game back in my school days when it came out.

The opening intro to the game absolutely blew me away back then. There was nothing else like it.

You play Gordon Freeman, a scientist guy who starts off by doing the average daily journey in to work at the Black Mesa Research Facility. From the outset, events begin to happen around you. From my memory, none of these events are thrust at you in the form of cutscenes, you are free to observe everything in real time. The immersion was incredible.

I don't want to give anything away in relation to the story, but be prepared for lots of shooting guns, smashing boxes with a crowbar, and lots of physics puzzles that fit right in with the environment and don't remove you from the immersion.

It was cutting edge stuff back then, I remember getting up early every day to play another part of the story before school (very few games could get me up early - it was just that good)

These days, obviously games have come a long way in terms of graphics. I replayed the first couple hours of Half Life recently, and I must admit that it didn't have the same wow factor I remember from my childhood. But hey, I know that I am spoiled with the next generation releases now. So bear the following in mind - this game was a gamechanger, and a vital part of gaming history. It may not impress as much these days alongside the newer releases, but it is definitely worth a look.
El mejor de la saga. Half Life 2 y sus sequelas tendran mejores graficos pero no tienen el gameplay tan afinado como el 1. Multiplayer sigue siendo muy activo y entretenido.

Half-Life is one of the most important video games of all time. It is a true masterpiece and everyone should have played it!
I can't recommend this classic enough and it is well worth playing. There is a nice option in the settings to enable HD models and textures, which I believe have come from the Blue Shift expansion. This version of the game plays brilliantly on today's hardware and at modern resolutions, such as 1440p. As such it will also play well on extremely old or underpowered hardware such as netbooks etc. To my surprise people are still playing the Multiplayer on this, with a load of servers and players in October 2019!
This is obviously a very great game, It may be old, but please play it! It's worth your time!

Half-Life is one of the most influential games of all time! While the game does feel outdated in the graphical and gameplay department, the story and world building is worth the playthrough! This is a must play for all gamers and it's dirt cheap on Steam sales so you really have no excuse to skip this.
Still holds up as one of the greatest linear story experiences gaming has to offer.

√áok konu≈ümaya gerek yok. Arkada≈ülar ile cs oynamaktan sƒ±kƒ±ldƒ±ysan iyi bir alternatif. Herhangi bir indirimde birka√ß skin satarak alƒ±nabilir.

Introduction

Half-Life is a first-person shooter that requires the player to perform combat tasks and puzzle solving to advance through the game. Unlike most of its peers at the time, Half-Life used scripted sequences, such as a Vortigaunt ramming down a door, to advance major plot points. Compared to most first-person shooters of the time, which relied on cut-scene intermissions to detail their plotlines, Half-Life's story is told mostly using scripted sequences (bar one short cutscene), keeping the player in control of the first-person viewpoint. In line with this, the player rarely loses the ability to control the player character, who never speaks and is never actually seen in the game; the player sees "through his eyes" for the entire length of the game. Half-Life has no "levels"; it instead divides the game into chapters, whose titles flash on the screen as the player moves through the game. Progress through the world is continuous, except for short pauses for loading.

The Good

The game regularly integrates puzzles, such as navigating a maze of conveyor belts or using nearby boxes to build a small staircase to the next area the player must travel to. Some puzzles involve using the environment to kill an enemy, like turning a valve to spray hot steam at their enemies. There are few bosses in the conventional sense, where the player defeats a superior opponent by direct confrontation. Instead, such organisms occasionally define chapters, and the player is generally expected to use the terrain, rather than firepower, to kill the boss. Late in the game, the player receives a "long jump module" for the HEV suit, which allows the player to increase the horizontal distance and speed of jumps by crouching before jumping. The player must rely on this ability to navigate various platformer-style jumping puzzles in Xen toward the end of the game.

For the most part the player battles through the game alone, but is occasionally assisted by non-player characters; specifically security guards and scientists who help the player; the guards will fight alongside the player, and both guards and scientists can assist in reaching new areas and impart relevant plot information. An array of alien enemies populate the game, including headcrabs, bullsquids, and headcrab zombies. The player also faces human opponents, in particular, Hazardous Environment Combat Unit (HECU) Marines and black ops assassins. 

Closing

The game is extremely well made, and even being 20+ years old, still holds up today. I happily give this game a 10/10.

The game runs on Goldsauce, a very special kind of sauce that every 90s gamer needs to play alongside the other Half-Life expansions.

Do you know who ate all the donuts?

This game and it's numerous sequels and mods created a milestone for Valve and propelled them into the world of being one of the most loved and beloved developers of PC games. While many may say that this game is mediocre or dated the first 3/4 of this game aren't as you explore the vast and chaos filled Black Mesa as a morally ambiguous scientist who set everything in motion. Gordon Freedman provided a blank slate for the player to project their own actions onto which Half-Life 2 would fail at with a bigger emphasis on characters. However, several missions like 'On A Rail', 'Surface Tension', and essentially every Chapter in Xen is designed like a COD Map and essentially turns the maze like levels earlier into very difficult shooting galleries. As well the boss fights leave more to be desired either being ultra easy or ultra hard. The 10-13 hour campaign is strong but leaves on an anti-climatic note. The multiplayer while fan-run is still very fun due to the fast movement and fun weapons. The fact that this game came out in a climate of Doom and Quake clones is extraordinary and despite it's dated shortcoming is without a doubt a masterpiece that influenced thousands of games to come.

Probably one of the most  influential games of all time,i have alot of great memories with this masterpiece and its as good as i remember it being,the flaw the gun play the pacing is all masterfully crafted and very well it combines fps,story telling and puzzle solving soo perfectly and seamlessly,there are tons of variety from the level design,enemies and overall things to do in general,it keeps surprising until the very end,the atmosphere is also mind blowing to say the least,however where it all falls apart sadly is at zen i really hated that level with passion even back then when i first played it,even gabe newell regrets creating it but it adds a new layer that some people may appreciate 

bottom line half life  is one of the most influential games out there and a must play for anyone who appreciate video games as an art form

There are very few words that could do this game justice. Some people insist those words are combinations of stuff like "not fun", or "bad graphics".. Those people are not smart, this game is wonderful for as old as it is. It is still a very enjoyable experience. Not to mention the number of hours you get for the price is practically a steal.

Take it from the endless numbers of people who agree, this game is where it all began, it's the start of something fantastic, and let me tell you, it sets the bar high.

Como punto negativo tal vez al modo historia le falto algo mas de narrativa, siento que solo al inicio y al final nos cuentan algo de informacion y a lo largo del juego solo son tiroteos y puzzles con peque√±as intervenciones de npc. Por los demas es excelente. Puntuacion: 9/10

Great game even if the graphics are now outdated the story is shown through the gameplay and conversations between scientists and guards talking to you throughout your journey. Freeman never has a break from platforming, puzzles and combat with the military and aliens no aspect of the game gets stale.

Got stuck in the silo and game wont let me through door, i have searched all corridors etc. could not find how to enable the oxygen and fuel for silo. Game has poor explanation what to do. not even a mission tracking list or something. I would not recommended!

EDIT Oct 6th, 2019: I change my review to positive and I am explaining why. The game as I wrote in my first review has poor explanation so maybe I used to see the solution in youtube 2 or 3 times but if I would look better I probably would have find the way on my own. Since I managed to play it through here is my rating:
I ignore multiplayer since I am not interested on it.
Gameplay: good
Shooting experience: good (not like new games for its time very good)
Story: very good. The story is the strong part of this game.
Graphics: Good for its time! Its a 1999 game dont expect much here. its like PlayStation 1.
HUD and user friendlyness: bad. this is the weak part of the game. You have no mission tracking or mini map or something where you can see what to do next. Therefore you have to listen carefully to the NPCs you meet during the game process.
But in overall I would recommend this game since it also supports Full HD resolution for newer PCs. I played it on windows 10 with i5 and GTX 1060. No crashes at all. Some minor glitches and bugs but they were not disturbing
